bio:treatment.description: Stems ovoid or ovoid-cylindric, 10–63 × 7.5–30 cm; ribs 13–17, undulate or crenate. Spines 12–16(–28) per areole; central spines 4(–8) per areole, principal central spine terete or angled, 60–165 × (0.5–)1–1.5(–2.5) mm, hard. Flowers 5.5–8(–10) × 6.5–9.5 cm; stigma lobes 11–14. Fruits green to greenish brown or dull brownish purple, 30–50 × 25–30 mm. Seeds 1.4–1.6 mm. 2n = 22.
Chihuahuan desert scrub, prairies, semidesert grasslands, oak-juniper savannas, pine-oak woodlands, stony hills, bluffs, and flats, igneous and calcareous substrates;
N.Mex., Tex.; Mexico (Chihuahua, Coahuila, Durango, San Luis Potosí, Zacatecas).
bio:treatment.discussion: In Mexico, plants of Ferocactus hamatacanthus var. hamatacanthus grow much larger; our measurements pertain only to northern specimens.
